Package diceTools

Class ProbMap<K>

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractMap<K,​V>
java.util.TreeMap<K,​java.lang.Double>
diceTools.ProbMap<K>
Type Parameters:
K - Type of the keys
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.function.Supplier<ProbMap<K>>, java.util.Map<K,​java.lang.Double>, java.util.NavigableMap<K,​java.lang.Double>, java.util.SortedMap<K,​java.lang.Double>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcreteProbMap, DicePoolMap, DiceRollMap
public abstract class ProbMap<K>
extends java.util.TreeMap<K,​java.lang.Double>
implements java.util.function.Supplier<ProbMap<K>>
Stores the probabilities of observing discrete events (such as dice rolls or darts scores).

Events and their probabilities are stored as key-value pairs, with HashMap as the underlying implementation. Event probabilities are stored as Doubles, which are permitted to take values greater than 1 or less than 0, but never null.

Author:
kieran
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • merge

      public java.lang.Double merge​(K key, java.lang.Double value)
      Perform HashMap.merge using sumMerger for the BiFunction
      Parameters:
      key - key with which the resulting value is to be associated
      value - the non-null value to be merged with the existing value associated with the key or, if no existing value or a null value is associated with the key, to be associated with the key
      Returns:
      the new value associated with the specified key, or null if no value is associated with the key

    • morph

      public ProbMap<K> morph​(java.util.function.Function<? super K,​? extends K> f)
      Map each key in the ProbMap to a key in a new ProbMap, where the key type remains the same.
      Parameters:
      f - rule for mapping keys
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the morphed data. The ProbMap returned is created using Supplier.get(), which is implemented by the subclass.

    • morph

      public <T> ProbMap<T> morph​(java.util.function.Function<? super K,​? extends T> f, java.util.function.Supplier<? extends ProbMap<T>> s)
      Map each key in the ProbMap to a key of a different type in a new ProbMap.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys of the generated ProbMap
      Parameters:
      f - rule for mapping keys
      s - Supplier which can get() an empty ProbMap with keys of the new type. Note that all concrete ProbMap<K> subclasses implement Supplier<ProbMap<K>>.
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the morphed data, created using s.get()

    • fork

      public ProbMap<K> fork​(java.util.function.Function<? super K,​? extends ProbMap<? extends K>> f)
      Map each key-value pair in the ProbMap to one or several key-value pairs in a new ProbMap, where the key type remains the same.
      Parameters:
      f - rule for mapping key-value pairs
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the forked data. The ProbMap returned is created using Supplier.get(), which is implemented by the subclass.

    • fork

      public <T> ProbMap<T> fork​(java.util.function.Function<? super K,​? extends ProbMap<? extends T>> f, java.util.function.Supplier<? extends ProbMap<T>> s)
      Map each key-value pair in the ProbMap to a pair with a different key type in a new ProbMap.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys in the new ProbMap
      Parameters:
      f - rule for mapping key-value pairs
      s - Supplier which can get() an empty ProbMap with keys of the new type. Note that all concrete ProbMap<K> subclasses implement Supplier<ProbMap<K>>.
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the forked data, created using s.get()

    • combine

      public <T> ProbMap<T> combine​(java.util.function.BiFunction<? super K,​? super T,​? extends T> f, ProbMap<T> p)
      Combine each key in the ProbMap with each key in a ProbMap. The probability of for each newly generated key is the product of the probabilities of the keys combined to create it.
      Type Parameters:
      T - key type of the ProbMap argument and the resulting ProbMap
      Parameters:
      f - rule for combining keys
      p - ProbMap to combine
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the combined data. The ProbMap returned is created using p.get, which is implemented by the subclass.

    • combine

      public <X,​ Y> ProbMap<Y> combine​(java.util.function.BiFunction<? super K,​? super X,​? extends Y> f, ProbMap<? extends X> p, java.util.function.Supplier<? extends ProbMap<Y>> s)
      Combine each key in the ProbMap with each key in a ProbMap. The probability of for each newly generated key is the product of the probabilities of the keys combined to create it.
      Type Parameters:
      X - key type of the ProbMap argument
      Y - key type of the resulting ProbMap
      Parameters:
      f - rule for combining keys
      p - ProbMap to combine
      s - Supplier which can get() an empty ProbMap with keys of the new type. Note that all concrete ProbMap<K> subclasses implement Supplier<ProbMap<K>>.
      Returns:
      ProbMap containing the combined data. The ProbMap returned is created using s.get, which is implemented by the subclass.

    • supplyMe

      public java.util.function.Supplier<? extends ProbMap<K>> supplyMe()
      Get a Supplier which gets this ProbMap.
      Returns:
      Supplier which supplies this ProbMap

    • normalise

      public void normalise()
      Normalise the probabilities in the ProbMap so that they sum to unity. This is equivalent to dividing each probability by the sum of all probabilities.

    • normalise

      public void normalise​(double norm)
      Normalise the probabilities in the ProbMap so that they sum to a given value. This is equivalent to dividing each probability by the ratio of the normalising value to the summ of all probabilities.
      Parameters:
      norm - normalising value. After returning, the values in the ProbMap sum to this value

    • getMode

      public static <T> java.util.Map.Entry<T,​java.lang.Double> getMode​(ProbMap<T> pm)
      Find the mode average of a ProbMap, and return it as a HashMap.Entry.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of the ProbMap keys
      Parameters:
      pm - ProbMap to find the mode average of
      Returns:
      Entry with the highest probability in the ProbMap

    • getMean

      public static <T> java.lang.Double getMean​(ProbMap<T> pm, java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends java.lang.Double> function)
      Find the mean average of a ProbMap by converting keys into Doubles.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys of the ProbMap
      Parameters:
      pm - ProbMap for which the mean average is to be found
      function - rule for converting keys into Doubles
      Returns:
      the sum of key Doubles multiplied by their probabilities

    • getMean

      public static <T extends java.lang.Number> java.lang.Double getMean​(ProbMap<T> pm)
      Find the mean average of a ProbMap of Numbers
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys of the ProbMap
      Parameters:
      pm - ProbMap for which the mean average is to be found
      Returns:
      the sum of key Doubles multiplied by their probabilities

    • getMedian

      public static <T> java.util.Map.Entry<T,​java.lang.Double> getMedian​(ProbMap<T> pm, java.util.Comparator<? super T> comp)
      Find the median average of a ProbMap when keys are ordered.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys of the ProbMap
      Parameters:
      pm - ProbMap for which the median is to be found
      comp - rule for ordering keys
      Returns:
      the first key which, when its probability is summed with the probabilities of all preceding keys, results in a probability greater than or equal to the sum of all the probabilities

    • getMedian

      public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> java.util.Map.Entry<T,​java.lang.Double> getMedian​(ProbMap<T> pm)
      Find the median average of a ProbMap when keys are ordered.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of the keys of the ProbMap
      Parameters:
      pm - ProbMap for which the median is to be found
      Returns:
      the first key which, when its probability is summed with the probabilities of all preceding keys, results in a probability greater than or equal to the sum of all the probabilities

      public K makeKey​(java.lang.Object oKey)
      Make a key from an Object. If more complex behaviour than casting is required, subclasses should override this method.
      Parameters:
      oKey - Object to be made into a key
      Returns:

    • keyIsValid

      public abstract boolean keyIsValid​(K key)
      Check whether a key is valid for use in the ProbMap. Note that all keys are sanitized with sanitizeKey(K) after validation, before they are presented to the underlying HashMap implementation.
      Parameters:
      key - key to check validity
      Returns:
      true is the key is valid, false otherwise

    • sanitizeKey

      public abstract K sanitizeKey​(K key)
      Sanitize a key. Called on all keys after they are verified with validateKey(K), before they are presented to the underlying HashMap implementation.
      Parameters:
      key - key to sanitize
      Returns:
      the sanitized key

    • get

      public abstract ProbMap<K> get()
      Get a new, empty ProbMap. Concrete implementations should return instances of the implementing class.
      Specified by:
      get in interface java.util.function.Supplier<K>
